Package curam.common.util.xml.dom

This package contains the Document Object Model (DOM) which provides a means of working with XML documents.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DomWrapper
    Interface to provide access to a wrapped dom4j Node.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Attribute
    An Attribute defines an XML attribute.
    CData
    A CData defines a CDATA XML element.
    Comment
    A Comment defines an XML element.
    Content
    Superclass for DOM objects which can be child content of Nodes.
    DocType
    A DocType defines an XML DOCTYPE declaration.
    Document
    A Document defines an XML document.
    DocumentFragment
    A DocumentFragment defines a minimal XML document that has no parent.
    DOMUtils
    A utility class for parsing w3c Documents and Nodes.
    Element
    An Element defines an XML element.
    ElementList
    This class wraps a dom4j list of Elements so that modifications to the list are propagated to the underlying dom4j list.
    Namespace
    A Namespace provides a method to avoid element name conflicts.
    ProcessingInstruction
    A ProcessingInstruction (PI) allows documents to contain instructions for applications.
    Text
    Text defines an XML Text node.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DataConversionException
    An exception class to represent data conversion exceptions.
    DOMException
    An exception class to represent DOM exceptions.

Package curam.common.util.xml.dom Description

This package contains the Document Object Model (DOM) which provides a means of working with XML documents. This implementation isolates the user from the underlying third-party library, which is dom4j.

Features:
  • full support for the Java Collections Framework (Java 2 Collections)
  • support for JAXP, TrAX, SAX, DOM, and XSLT
  • XPath support for easy navigation of XML documents
  • event based proccessing mode to support for massive documents or XML streams
Since:
8.0.2
See Also:
https://dom4j.github.io
